Category Coronavirus live updates: China’s death toll, confirmed cases China’s National Health Commission said there have been an additional 46 deaths and 2,102 new confirmed cases, as of the end of Friday. Streamed live on Jan 29, 2020 Live figures from the rapidly spreading coronavirus outbreak in China that has already killed more than 150 people on the mainland. Category —About 64,456 confirmed coronavirus cases (primarily in mainland China), according to the Johns Hopkins virus dashboard. — 1,384 deaths linked to the virus. Deaths worldwide exceed those from The novel coronavirus outbreak has now killed 1,107 people worldwide, of which all but two were in mainland China. The global number of confirmed coronavirus cases has now exceeded 44,138.

Wednesday’s coronavirus live updates The deadly new coronavirus continued to spread Tuesday, with more than 24,000 cases and at least 492 deaths confirmed worldwide. The virus: The Wuhan coronavirus has killed 910 people globally, the vast majority in mainland China, and infected more than 40,000 people. As of the end of Jan. 28, the province said that brings cases in the region to 3,554 and its death toll to 125, with the majority of those located in Hubei’s capital city, Wuhan. Hubei also said At least 908 people have died and more than 40,000 been infected with the new coronavirus, including almost two dozen Americans on a quarantined cruise ship.
